meanings.definition: To plan excessively or in too much detail.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overplan every event, making it stressful for everyone involved.
meanings.sent2: I always overplan my vacations, scheduling every minute of the day.
meanings.sent3: He decided to overplan his birthday party, but ended up forgetting the most important details.
meanings.sent4: Trying to overplan every aspect of your life can lead to missing out on spontaneous moments.
meanings.sent5: Her tendency to overplan everything often results in disappointment when things don't go as expected.

meanings.definition: To create a plan that is overly complicated or unrealistic.
meanings.sent1: The architect tends to overplan his designs, adding unnecessary features that complicate the building process.
meanings.sent2: When you overplan a project, you risk losing sight of the main goals and getting lost in the details.
meanings.sent3: She decided to overplan her Halloween costume, ending up with a costume that was too heavy to wear.
meanings.sent4: Overplanning a road trip can be like mapping out a journey to Mars when all you need is a drive to the next town.
meanings.sent5: His tendency to overplan his speeches often results in confusing the audience with too much information.
